title: How many people in the US will have received one or more doses of a COVID-19 vaccine as of 30 June 2021, according to the CDC?
preds: Probably the last one to the party....
likely in option #2 according to current CDC numbers but always an outside chance with summer break that more people will find the time...

This is a no brain question. Anyone can look up online statistics to this question. The result online now are between 55% to 60% of the USA population having at least 1 vaccine dose. It still far short of 70% by July 4, 2021. This vaccination problem is not new, each year half the USA population are reluctant or forget to get their annual Flu vaccine. This Pandemic is not over, because their are more diseases merging. Here is a link about a new one:
https://www.nytimes.com/2021/06/02/world/asia/h10n3-bird-flu.html
So scientist start making a vaccine for h10n3, because it is out there now!

June 11 - 172.76M
June 14 - 174.23M
June 15 - 174.67M
June 16 - 175.05M
June 17 - 175.87M
June 18 - 176.29M
June 20 - 177.01M = 0.41M doses/day and avg is ~0.4722 doses/day Would need a 100% increase over the next 10 days and trends are down. Bumping to 100.
First doses are slowing. Current projection ~183M.

June 11 - 172.76M
June 14 - 174.23M
June 15 - 174.67M
June 16 - 175.05M
June 17 - 175.87M
June 18 - 176.29M = 0.42M doses/day and avg is ~0.504 doses/day Bumping up to 99.

Whatever they're doing to get people vaccinated, it's working. Numbers aren't falling yet; they're going up slightly. 0.50M/day added in the past week. With 16 days left in the forecast (inc. 4 for back reporting), if that pace were kept up, we'd see 176.29M + 0.50M*16 = 184.29M. But, that pace likely won't be kept up all month. So I don't think it's likely we'll get to 185M.

June 11 - 172.76M
June 14 - 174.23M
June 15 - 174.67M
June 16 - 175.05M
June 17 - 175.87M = 0.82M doses/day and avg is ~0.5183 doses/day A big jump up, I could see 185,000 possibly not out of reach.

June 11 - 172.76M
June 14 - 174.23M
June 15 - 174.67M
June 16 - 175.05M = 0.38M doses/day (this is down from .44M) Raising odds to 99%

The adding of the data after the fact scares me on these two questions, but taking the 7-day avg from 6/10 and adding it (X20) to the total on that date gives 181.55M.  Just don't see this hitting 185M.

June 11 - 172.76M
June 14 - 174.23M
June 15 - 174.67M = 0.44M doses/day (this is down from .49M) This is as of June 15, with 15 days left we have approximately 174.67 M doses + 15*0.44 M doses/day so estimating 181.27 M doses by 30 June 2021. <175M bucket certainly deserves 0% allocation at this point. For upper bound. (185M - 174.67M)/15 days = 0.688 M doses/day would represent an increase of 38% from current levels. Keeping current forecast. https://covid.cdc.gov/covid-data-tracker/#vaccinations

June 11 - 172.76M
June 14 - 174.23M 1.47M doses/3days ~ 0.49M doses/day  This is as of June 14, with 16 days left we have approximately 174.23 M doses + 16*0.49 M doses/day so estimating 181.58 M doses by 30 June 2021.   For a lower bound.  (175M - 174.23M)/16 days = .048M doses/day which would represent 9% of current distribution levels/day.  Barring some black swan event, this seems nearly impossible maybe not even worthy of the 1%.   For upper bound.  (185M - 174.23M)/16 days = 0.67 M doses/day which would represent an increase of 37% from current levels.  With the number of vaccines being distributed trending down this seems unlikely as well, but certainly more likely than the lower bound.   Will update daily.  https://covid.cdc.gov/covid-data-tracker/#vaccinations
We've hit a plateau. Most who want the vaccine have it. As of June 15th we still haven't reached 175M

173.84M as of today. 20 days left in forecast (inc. 3 for back reporting). For each 0.1M avg added/day, add 2M to the total. 0.47M/day added in the past 3 days. At this rate, total will be <185M. Vaccinations are not slowing down, but how long will that last? Could they increase? Would need to add 0.56M/day to reach 185M. Not likely, but I'll hold at 2% for this category.
Would need to reach 180.70M to reach the equivalent of 70% of the adult population. We will probably barely or almost get there by July 4. It's likely that 70% of the adult population will not be vaccinated by July 4.
I guess a push before July 4 can't be ruled out. Adding something to bin 3.

0.43M/day added in the past week.
An average of <0.10M/day for the rest of the forecast period would need to be added to stay <175M. That isn't likely.
If the current pace were kept up with no decline, 0.43M/day * 23 days = 9.89M would be added; 172.76M (as of 6/11) + 9.89M = 182.65M. I believe this is a ceiling, as the pace at which people are added isn't likely to increase at this point, offers of free beer notwithstanding.

172.8m plus 1m backlog = 173.8m
18 days to go.
Daily average @375k and unlikely to increase much
Thresholds
175m = 1.2m = 67k per day
185m = 11.2m = 622k per day
I looked at the vaccination curves for the last 30 days which seem to be going slower and slower. I then made head predictions (I did not do a linear regression).
Most have gotten vaccine that want it. Widely available
Short time horizon. widely available. Most who want to be vaccinated have done so.

0.46M/day added in the past week, and might not slow down much for another week or so. 171.7M as of 6/8. 1st bin increasingly unlikely.
But I don't think there's much chance of the 3rd bin. 25 days left in forecast (inc. 3 for back reporting). To get to >185M, we'd need to see an average of 13.3M / 25 = 0.53M/day. We haven't even been at that level over the past week, and vaccinations have been generally declining for a long time. I just can't picture that.
The current flow would lead me to expect it to land between 178M and 183M by the 30th.

Ok, <175M is looking less likely. 0.48M added in the past day; total currently at 171.3M. I'm higher than the crowd for <175M, though, because I think it's quite possible that in a couple weeks or so, the vaccination rate could start to fall pretty low.
Considering a smaller decline next week than I had been thinking about previously.

Today at 170.27M. 0.54M added in the past day. The average doses administered/day will probably be in the ballpark of ~0.5M/day, although there could be a bump of 2nd doses of adolescents. The number of people added to the total for this forecast is currently 47% of doses administered, so I'll guess that ~1.2M will be added for the rest of this week, and ~0.24M/day will be added to this category next week, or ~3M (ballpark) by the end of next week. That would bring us to ~173.3M, with 21 days left in the forecast (inc. 3 for back reporting). At that point, fewer than 0.1M people/day would need to be added to the total to stay under 175M, or roughly fewer than .2M/day doses would need to be given on average for the rest of the month. Not since Dec. 28 have fewer than 0.2M Covid vaccine doses/day been given. So, it may be hard for us to conceive of a time when vaccination clinics aren't giving hundreds of thousands of doses each day; nonetheless, that day is coming, and it's probably coming very soon. We are currently at <1M doses/day administered on average; next week, we'll probably be at around 0.5M/day, and the week after, we may be at half that. It may be that after next week (Sunday, June 13), we only add ~1.6M people to this category over the rest of the month. So, I'm most likely going to sabotage my Brier score by assigning substantially higher weight to the possibility of staying <175 than the crowd does. I think this forecast could end up quite close to the dividing line between bins 1 and 2. We should have a much better idea over the next week or 2. If we end up at 174M by the end of next week, then we'll probably end up over 175M by the end of the month. If we end up under 173M by the end of next week, then I think we'll probably end up under 175M by the end of the month.

169.7m plus 1.5m backlog = 171.2m
25 days to go.  Current rate 500k per day and dropping.  Likely to drop as hit saturation
Threshold
175m = 3.8m = 152k per day
185m = 13.8m = 552k per day
Unlikely to get far beyond this with current rates and profile.

I think we'll soon be down to adding 0.1M/day. I don't think it's very likely we'll get to 175M. I know there's a huge focus on incentives, and today more vaccinations were reported, but I don't expect a lot this month.
Currently around 170, we did about 20 million over the last month, I'm guessing about 10 million this month.
Best guess is 167M–176M. Still unsure where this floor will be.
Don't know what the baseline will be (UNCERTAINTY!) but I am favoring that it'll steep low, stay low, and bring us just shy of 175 or 176 million.
This one gave me a headache, too. Time to get off this computer.

31 days to the end of the forecast, including 3 days for back reporting. Current total 168.7M. To stay under 175.0M, we'd need to add an average of <0.20M/day for the rest of the forecast period. I think we'll soon be down to 0.20M/day, maybe by late next week, but I'm not sure whether we'll go low enough to stay under 175.0M. Update 6/3: 0.36M added in the past day, and this should be a high day of the week. We may see 0.2M/day as an average pretty soon.

Apr 23, 2021 · At least 123,917,385 people or 37% of the population have received at least one dose. Overall, 69,211,473 people or 21% of the population have been fully vaccinated. In the US, 250,998,265 doses have been distributed so far, with 77% or 194,791,836 of the doses used.
Posted on: April 22, 2021
https://usafacts.org/visualizations/covid-vaccine-tracker-states/
